newsitem.title: USA: Pratt & Whitney wins $67.9 million contract.
newsitem.headline: Pratt & Whitney wins $67.9 million contract.

text.p: Pratt & Whitney Government Engines & Space Propulsion, a unit of United Technologies Corp, said on Tuesday it received a $67.9 million contract for engines and related support for the production of F-16C/D aircraft to be leased by the Singapore Air Force.

The contract for the F100-PW-229 engines is part of an agreement between Singapore and Lockheed Martin Corp to replace F-16C/Ds leased from the U.S. Air Force. That lease runs out in 1998, Pratt & Whitney said in a statement.
